titleStmt.title: William T. Samuels to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5663

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS,
Attorney at Law & General Collecting Agent,
FRANKFORT, KY.
☞ Special attention given to the collection of all claims confided to him throughout the State of Kentucky.

☞ No claim whatever will be paid, unless the person to whom the claim is ordered to be paid by the Court, assigns or indorses it, by writing his name upon the back of said claim, in the same manner as a check or draft, drawn to order, is transferred or assigned.

Frankfort, Ky., July 2 1864.
Hon
Tho. E. Bramlette
Gov. of Ky,
Dr. Sir

W. M. Samuels, Shff. of Hickman Co. this day paid the Revenue, of Hickman County for 1858, with Interest and Cost, charged to S. W. Rennick, as Shff. of said Co. for said year, & now prays your Excellency to be relieved from the payment of Four Hundred & Twenty Two. 48/100 Dollars, this being the amt. of Damages, adjudged against said Rennick for the non payment of the Revenue of said County for said ^year^ in time as required by Law
Whose prayer, I hope you will grant.

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
L. W. Rennick
shff
Remit damages
Tho E Bramlette
2d July/64
